com.teamboid.twitterapi.status

Class StatusUpdate

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.teamboid.twitterapi.status.StatusUpdate
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class StatusUpdate
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represents a Status update, passed to Twitter.updateStatus().
    Author:
    Aidan Follestad
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static StatusUpdate create(java.lang.String status)
        Builds a StatusUpdate instance to pass in Twitter.updateStatus().
        Parameters:
        status - The text of your status update, typically up to 140 characters. URL encode as necessary. t.co link wrapping may effect character counts.
        Returns:
        a prepared StatusUpdate instance.

      • setMedia

        public StatusUpdate setMedia(java.io.File file)
        Attaches an image to the status update.
        Parameters:
        file - The picture file to attach.

      • setMedia

        public StatusUpdate setMedia(java.io.InputStream stream)
        Attaches an image to the status update.
        Parameters:
        stream - The stream containing a raw image to upload.

      • setLocation

        public StatusUpdate setLocation(GeoLocation location)
        Attaches location to the status update.
        NOTE: Attaching your location will only work if the current account has enabled location by checking "Add location to my Tweets" in their account settings on Twitter's website.
        Parameters:
        location - The coordinates to attach.

      • setDisplayCoordinates

        public StatusUpdate setDisplayCoordinates(boolean displayCoordinates)
        Sets whether or not to display your exact coordinates (when location is also attached) as opposed to your location relative to places.

      • setInReplyToStatusId

        public StatusUpdate setInReplyToStatusId(long id)
        Sets the ID of the status that this tweet is replying to, connecting them in conversation.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of another tweet that this tweet is replying to.

      • setPlaceId

        public StatusUpdate setPlaceId(java.lang.String placeId)
